thread.title: Friends of the Library giant book sale is back
thread.title_full: Friends of the Library giant book sale is back

title: Friends of the Library giant book sale is back
text:
The Giant Book Sale is back. Join in this beloved tradition and shop for a good cause Saturday, April 13-14 at the Lane Events Center Performance Hall. Admission and parking are free.
The sale goes from 9 a.m.-4 p.m. April 13 and 10 a.m.-3 p.m. April 14.
Proceeds from this all-volunteer project help support Eugene Public Library activities and events, including Summer Reading books and programs for children and teens.
Shoppers can browse thousands of gently used and like-new books, most at the bargain price of $2. Choices include fiction and nonfiction in paperback and hardcover, all genres, recent bestsellers and rare and specialty books. Also for sale will be DVDs, audio books, music books, music CDs, vintage magazines, novelties, and a large selection of children's books, DVDs, and CDs.
Members of the Friends of Eugene Public Library will be offered an early admission opportunity. Please bring your own bag or box to carry your treasures away.
The Book Sale is the Friends of Eugene Public Library's major fundraiser each year. More than 400 volunteers work on the sale, many year-round. To volunteer or to join the Friends, visit their website to find more information .
Note to shoppers: If you come to the Book Sale after noon Saturday or anytime Sunday, you can walk right in. Or if you want to be among the first to enter, here are two ways to do that:
Do you have gently used books and other items to donate? It's easy! Drop them off in the Downtown Library parking garage; at the Rite-Aid next to Sheldon Branch; or at Petersen Barn Community Center near Bethel Branch. If you have a large collection, contact the Friends for possible pick-up. Learn more about donating books to the Friends.
